title: Stunning
review: An exquisite American work, a kind of moralized, plot-driven and highly stylized film in the same psychological vein as Mike Leigh's 'Naked,' to which I thought it paid some homage.  While it didn't devastate me to anywhere near the degree that 'Naked' did, I found the theme and presentation almost as challenging and thought-provoking, felt much of the same sort of empathy for the characters, and was genuinely creeped-out by several developments.  Burnstyn was robbed, absolutely robbed, and if I ever meet Julia Roberts, those are the first words out of my mouth.This guy's doing the next Batman?'   ...Whoa.
